posts.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to enforce Alien Enemies Act for rapid deportations for now
top_comments:
> The unsigned decision in the case, the most closely watched emergency appeal pending at the Supreme Court, lets Trump invoke the 1798 law to speed removals while litigation over the act’s use plays out in lower courts. The court stressed that people deported going forward should receive notice they are subject to the act and an opportunity to have their removal reviewed.

This strikes me as SCOTUS knowing it won't stand up, but wanting to give the administration more time to mass deport people until the cases play out in the lower courts and actually require a final decision from them. It's the same thing they did with the presidential immunity case. Delay enough that the damage is done by the time they make a decision.


> The court’s three liberal justices dissented from the decision, and Justice Amy Coney Barrett, a member of the court’s conservative wing, partially dissented.

Amy Coney Barrett being the dark horse. I know it's only a partial dissent, but of the conservative justices, she's seemed the most likely to not go blindly along.
Oh, is this the same Supreme Court that gave Trump broad immunity from prosecution for illegal acts he committed during his time as President?
OFC they are. They are Trump puppets.

AP article - "In a bitterly divided 5-4 decision, the court said the migrants still must get a chance to challenge their deportation before they are taken out of the country and said the Trump administration must give them “reasonable time” to go to court.

But the conservative majority said the legal challenges must take place in Texas, instead of a Washington courtroom."
I didn't know we were at war, a clear line in the original law being ignored by the Supreme Court is insane. "Immigrants" today, you tomorrow.

This order is going to immediately be abused despite everyone knowing what’s going to happen.  The Supreme Court just shit its pants and leaving us with the mess.  If you look like someone who could be deported. you might want to start carrying information that proves your citizenship, but let’s be real it probably won’t matter to ice.  You can be damn sure that trump and his band of dip ships will do everything in their power to make sure any errors that result in people being harmed won’t be fixed.
The Supreme Court is allowing Trump to break the law and seize unconstitutional power. How dare they disgrace our nation.

"Supreme Court Anoints Trump Emperor With Power to Arrest and Deport Anyone Without Recourse"

ftfy
Remember when the supreme Court said that forgiving student debt was a unlawful use of presidential executive orders?
Congress never declared war, so I guess it is official. Congress is no longer needed unless a Democrat is President.

posts.title: Chief Justice Roberts pauses deadline for return of Maryland man mistakenly deported to El Salvador
top_comments:
“The Executive branch may not seize individuals from the streets, deposit them in foreign prisons in violation of court orders, and then invoke the separation of powers to insulate its unlawful actions from judicial scrutiny,”

Who can disagree with this?

UPDATES: 

[Chief Justice John Roberts temporarily lifts order requiring Trump administration to un-deport Dilmar Abrego Garcia from a prison in El Salvador by midnight tonight.](https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/25881586-24a949-admin-stay-and-cfr/)
https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/25881586-24a949-admin-stay-and-cfr/

[Abrego Garcia filed a response already:](https://www.supremecourt.gov/DocketPDF/24/24A949/354927/20250407153131040_2025.04.07%20Respondents%20Opp%20to%20App%20to%20Vacate.pdf)

The Supreme Court docket doesn't show timestamps, but this was filed around the same time as Chief Justice Roberts' order (which requested a response by tomorrow).

Even if the SC rules against the Trump admin, the fact that they're treating this blatantly illegal and immoral act as the status quo which must stand in the interim is in itself absolutely monstrous.

>But he is no longer in U.S. custody and the government has no way to get him back, the administration argued.

If this full ordeal passes Supreme Court muster, the Musk/Trump administration can effectively *'memory hole'* anyone. Oopsies we accidentally misplaced [a journalist](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/apr/07/markwayne-mullin-journalists-violence-comments). Sorry, we accidentally deported a [sitting congresswoman](https://www.axios.com/2025/02/11/ilhan-omar-deport-brandon-gill-fundraisng). It starts here with this.

Then, how are they *ever* supposed to come back? Were they sentenced to life in a foreign prison with no due process? Because, let's be clear about what happened; they were not deported. They were imprisoned.
It would be one thing if we merely deported him where he got off the plane in his home country and we said ‘good luck’. But we took him directly to a notorious prison.
Roberts is now complicit in the extrajudicial kidnapping of a man.

Time for federal courts to start sanctioning and holding DOJ/agency lawyers in contempt. They say they cannot demand someone be returned, but they themselves can spend a night or two in jail to consider it.
This is the death of ALL civil rights. If the courts can't order his return they can't order yours.
**April 19th is the next national day of protest**. Channel the anger into something useful and find a protest near you [here](https://www.fiftyfifty.one) or start one of your own.

This will get out of hand and we'll be lucky to live through it.

Imagine if the lie of both parties are the same hadn't been pushed for decades? Maybe we'd have more liberal supreme court justices and judges in general.

Can someone *not* go along with this super villain shit?


Are there no cops in this country with *any* dignity?

It is incredibly troubling that the protestors that the police are targeting are either Palestinian or Middle Eastern. So the fact they went after this particular attorney feels like it falls right in line with those trends.

They're all accomplices in the installment of a fascist regime

top_comments: Those 2 actually have a backbone. Hope they get picked up by a better company
Unethical policies are a prerequisite for becoming a billion dollar corporation

We’re asking too much of For-Profit entities and too little of our politicians who are actually flesh and blood and who are supposed to be there working for the good of the country, not the shareholders.

The perpetrator of Jan-6 was never held to account and that’s a bigger dilemma than some Corporation not having a soul. It never did.
AIPAC has America in a strangle hold

The headline is correct but also misleading.  Both engineers interrupted the 50th anniversary speeches from Microsoft CEOs to protest.  The first engineer insulted her department CEO and her company.   The second one apparently did the same thing.  Both then fired off executive email carpet bombs.  You will absolutely be canned for doing that.
Unfortunately, I am not entirely surprised by this move.

Unsurprising employees don’t usually get to dictate what companies can do especially regarding multi million dollar deals. 

At the same time the software engineer job market is so saturated that they’ll fill these job posts almost immediately if they wanted to.
Time to change to LibreOffice

Every company does things that employees may find unethical. 

Philip Morris's products have contributed to the deaths of untold millions over the decades and people still work there.
Confirming once again that MS is a shit company

posts.title: Villanova Student Demands Man Who Recorded Her Sexual Assault Not Walk at Graduation
top_comments:
It's insane to me that this guy was never charged with a crime. It's also insane to me that the actual rapist got a plea bargain with zero prison time.

This isn't a "he said, she said" sort of case, there's *actual fucking video of the guy raping an unconscious woman*. There's zero question regarding whether it happened or whether it was consensual. It did and it wasn't. This is an open-and-shut case. Everyone involved should have been charged and very quickly convicted, and all three of them should be sitting in a prison cell at this very moment.

So he not only filmed the assault in her dorm, the rapist and the cameraman removed her unconscious body and dumped her in a bathroom on the ground floor of the dorm..


Ummm what the fuck? Why aren't they both rotting in prison?

We, as a society, should not and cannot allow people like this to just walk away. This young woman’s life will never be the same because of what these assholes did to her. And Villanova should be fucking ashamed of themselves already, notwithstanding possibly allowing this guy to walk at graduation. This is a complete failure by the school administration and the so called “justice system” in the US. Women’s rights, and voices, are being taken away every fucking day and I cannot believe there are not more men standing up about this. I have a mother, a wife, a sister, and a niece. Every time I read something like this it pisses me off that some sexual assaulter/rapist just gets to proceed with their lives while the woman is expected to maintain her silence. It’s infuriating, depressing, and sickening all at once. 

Edit: I just wrote an email to the Villanova administration imploring them to not allow this rapist to walk at commencement in front of his victim. That would set a tremendously awful precedent.

> I do have a feeling that this repulsive little man is going to walk across the stage with the rest of us. They’ll read his name. They’ll hand him his diploma. And then he gets to just forget about all this. She’ll never forget.

We need to start tattooing foreheads or something else permanent, because this is a good point.

This assault will likely be foundational for the victim, something that shapes the way she lives the rest of her life.

This guy who recorded and helped dumped her body, along with a third guy who helped "move her head around", didn't even get charged with a crime. And the guy who did the actual assaulting didn't even get any jail time.

They just get to walk away.

name 'em, shame 'em

Fuck Juan Eguiguren of Villanova University and Andrew Polun of Towson University for helping and recording the rape of an unconscious woman.

and the biggest fuck you to ELIJAH KATZENELL for raping her. None of these men went to jail for what they did. Disgusting.
Why are any of these rapist still in School much less graduating. They should be in jail.
If they don’t have the moral courage to expel the kid after he recorded and basically participated in a sexual assault, I doubt they’ll suddenly grow it to prevent him from walking at graduation.
The fact that Villanova allowed him to finish his education there is damning.  That's an easy expulsion in my view.  Of COURSE he shouldn't be allowed to walk at the ceremony.

If Villanova does allow Eguiguren to participate in graduation, Edelstein writes that this “would defy basic logic and would be yet another public offense to moral decency concerning victims/survivors of sexual assault… If Villanova bends once more to the wants of an individual who videotaped a rape and moved the body of an unconscious and unsuspecting rape victim, the institution will once again be protecting the wrong student. Respectfully, I cannot fathom that this is where Villanova wishes to draw a line in the sand, and plant its school flag, in favor of an admitted videographer of a rape in Villanova’s dormitory.”

To all the men who wonder why women are afraid of men andwhy they are afraid to report being raped by a man to authorities because the blame is hers and then he is allowed not only to walk free but to be able to walk the stage for graduation is disgusting.

If I were your friend; I would have a giant sign saying Joe Smith is a rapist as he walked the stage. By the time they drag me out, the message is clear. Everyone will have their camera in hand - I would have one those obnoxious air horns to be sure it becomes part of the graduation memories.

posts.title: Trump administration fires senior Navy female officer at NATO. She appeared on a 'woke' list
top_comments:
*The letter said Chatfield posted supportive comments on LinkedIn about a diversity summit and gave a speech in 2015 at Women’s Equality Day. The group quoted her as saying that investing in empowering women can unlock human potential.*

*And they also said she was quoted as saying, “our diversity is our strength” — a phrase that Hegseth has repeatedly condemned.*


She was fired for years old comments that didn't draw any ire if you are a rational adult.
When this is over, they need to mount a plaque at the Pentagon with the names of all the service members that were sacrificed in the name of MAGA's woke phobia.

This is the administration blatantly being assholes in broad daylight and seemingly getting away with it. 

Trump and the GOP are making a mockery of this once great country.
Their pettiness knows no bounds, they are off the leash, shitting and pissing on everything, pandering to the MAGA weirdos and destroying any goodwill with our allies. 
How is anyone OK with this?
I assume denounciations, false accusations by right wing influencers and grifters will slowly deplete our government and armed forces of competent employees and leaders. What could possibly go wrong?
Under the cover of DEI, they are going to get rid of senior level women wherever they can.

Evangelicals are worried about the persecution of Christians.

Jesus reached out to the marginalized. He’d be considered ‘woke’.

And woke is now being persecuted.
I look forward to the lawsuit
Admiraling while female is enough to get you fired these days.
She should sue their asses on First Amendment and Title VII grounds.

What I do not understand and probably never will is how any active or retired military can support Trump. He’s all talk. I am sure there are countless soldiers who worked with and under her that would literally go through hell for her and with her. I am also sure that many of those same people voted for Trump and would still vote for Trump. It’s sick and unbelievable that we’re this broken.

posts.title: Sailor killed in Pearl Harbor attack finally ID'd 84 years later, bringing closure to family
top_comments:
“My mom used to say she loved to people watch,” McCrimmon told WHRO. “She would go anywhere she could get a chance to go to a little town and just watch all the men go by to see if she could see Neil.” 

that’s so heartbreaking omg

it’s a shame that only his youngest sister is left and not a couple more of his siblings, but I’m glad there was at least one of them left to see this. Rip

I'm glad his family will finally get some closure. It's insane to think about the scale of death and tragedy of WW2. 80 years later, the DPAA is still IDing unknown remains on an almost daily basis. Theyve made a lot of progress lately with remains from Pearl Harbor and Japanese POW camps.
He was so young. That's sad
Still had a baby face. RIP
Just in time for the current admiration to erase his name from history.
He looks like a kid.  How sad.
Im so glad he got to come home.
Rest easy brother. We have the watch.
Look at that face. We had children saving the world, only for one doddering, diaper-filling old coward to dismantle it.
He looks like a kid. I think we sometimes forget how young these heroes were that fought in our wars.

posts.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to enforce Alien Enemies Act for rapid deportations for now
top_comments:
> The unsigned decision in the case, the most closely watched emergency appeal pending at the Supreme Court, lets Trump invoke the 1798 law to speed removals while litigation over the act’s use plays out in lower courts. The court stressed that people deported going forward should receive notice they are subject to the act and an opportunity to have their removal reviewed.

This strikes me as SCOTUS knowing it won't stand up, but wanting to give the administration more time to mass deport people until the cases play out in the lower courts and actually require a final decision from them. It's the same thing they did with the presidential immunity case. Delay enough that the damage is done by the time they make a decision.


> The court’s three liberal justices dissented from the decision, and Justice Amy Coney Barrett, a member of the court’s conservative wing, partially dissented.

Amy Coney Barrett being the dark horse. I know it's only a partial dissent, but of the conservative justices, she's seemed the most likely to not go blindly along.
Oh, is this the same Supreme Court that gave Trump broad immunity from prosecution for illegal acts he committed during his time as President?

AP article - "In a bitterly divided 5-4 decision, the court said the migrants still must get a chance to challenge their deportation before they are taken out of the country and said the Trump administration must give them “reasonable time” to go to court.

But the conservative majority said the legal challenges must take place in Texas, instead of a Washington courtroom."
